result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Richard Pruden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today May 12, 2016.
Attorney's have 10 days to obtain credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Defendant to complete any additional programming as Agent deems necessary.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to maintain employment.
-Defendant to obtain GED/HSED.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Carli or Carol Sarafin or their residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Richard Pruden

records.addlTxt: DE called stating he pd SDC w/guaranteed funds & needs his jmts satisfied. DE was advised that we only rec'd a partial pymt from SDC for him this mo, but DE confirmed that he did pay the remaining $994.63 to SDC w/guaranteeds funds @ their EC location. DE was advised that we don't typically satisfy jmts til the money is rec'd from SDC, but that b/c we did receive confirmation of his pymt in full, we will satisfy his jmts, but one case will still show a remaining bal til SDC sends that pymt next mo. DE's agent may call to confirm. Includes 14CF103, 14CF507. jaf

DE called stating he missed some pymts, but would like to get this pd off by Feb for credit reasons. DE was advised that he missed his Nov & Dec pymts & has already been turned over to SDC. DE was given SDC's ph # & encouraged to contact them ASAP to make pymt & that we do not satisfy jmts til pymt is rec'd from SDC in full which is only once monthly. Includes 14CF103, 14CF507. jaf

From DE stating his notice says pymt is due 9/11, but it's on a wkd & he'd like to get it pd ahead of time, but lost the paperwork. Ret'd call to DE & went over the details of his PPA w/him along w/his pymt options. DE stated he did receive a copy of his PPA via text from the person that opened his mail for him & will make pymt today. Includes 14CF103, 14CF507. jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF:  Daniel Richard Pruden appeared. Case called at 8:16. 13CF205, 14CF103, 14CF507, 15CF288. ADA Hartung updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF507 and 14CF103. In 14CF507 Ct. 3, Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony. Court acknowledges the plea to Ct. 3. DE acknowledges the theft charges in 13CF205 and 15CF288 and accepts responsibility for the theft charges. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF507 and guilty of 14CF103. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses 13CF205 for purposes of restitution, Ct. 1 of 15CF288 for purposes of restitution and out right dismisses Ct. 2-6 in 15CF288 and Ct. 1 in 14CF507. Court orders a PSI completed within the next 60 days. Bond continues. Monies to be moved to the files for restitution and costs. On  13CF205- Restitution will be joint and several with C. Eggum 14CF302.   Address confirmed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Hartung. Requesting a plea date. km
